meanings.sent1: The snivelly villain ran away at the first sign of trouble.
meanings.sent2: He always acted snivelly when faced with a challenge.
meanings.sent3: The snivelly character in the story was always up to no good.
meanings.sent4: Her snivelly behavior made her unpopular among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The snivelly actions of the bully were truly despicable.

meanings.definition: To behave in a whining or tearful manner
meanings.sent1: She would snivelly complain whenever things didn't go her way.
meanings.sent2: The child began to snivelly after dropping his ice cream.
meanings.sent3: He snivelly begged for forgiveness after breaking the vase.
meanings.sent4: The politician tried to snivelly his way out of the scandal.
meanings.sent5: The puppy would snivelly whenever it was left alone.
